bibl.title: Chin Hing v. United States of America. Certificate
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: Incl. no. 7 Department of Commerce and Labor

I hereby certify that the annexed is a true copy of the original memorandum ompanying digest of evidence, which were attached to the appeal record in Chin Hing, when said record was submitted to the Acting Secretary of er date of September 22, 1914, and also when the said record was submitted the Secretary of Labor under date of November 13, 1914, bearing the noapproval of the Acting Secretary under date of September 25, and of the secretary under date of November 13, 1914. on file in bureau of Immigration
A. Caminetti Commissioner General of Immigration

Office of the secretary I heareby certifythat A Caminetti who signed the following certificate, is now, and was at the time of signing, Commissioner General of Immigration and that credit should be given to his certification as such. In witness whereof, I have hereunto subscribed my name, and caused the seal of the Department of Commerce and Labor to be affixed this 20th day of November one thousand ninehundred and fourteen. Louis F. Post Assisstant Secretaty of Commerce and Labor
